name: Camellia at Solaire
description:
ABOUT THE HOME ENERGY RATING SCALE
The HERS (Home Energy Rating System) Index allows buyers to compare the relative energy efficiency of different homes. The HERS Index home energy rating is determined by an independent RESNET-certified home energy rater ("Rater"). The lower a home’s score, the more energy efficient it is in comparison to the HERS referenced home. For every one-point decrease in the HERS Index score, there is a corresponding one percent (1%) reduction in energy consumption as compared to a home with a HERS Index of 100. A home with a HERS score of 100 reflects a home built to 2006 IEEC Building Codes. See the bottom of this page for more information on HERS scores.

amenities.name: Solaire master
amenities.description: The Solaire master plan community is comprised of approximately 3,073 residential units.

amenities.name: Roughly miles
amenities.description: Roughly 7 miles west of Highway 65, which connects to Intestate 80, for ease of access to Sacramento, the Bay Area to the southwest and Reno, Nevada to the northeast.

amenities.name: Nearby local
amenities.description: Nearby local retail, shopping and dining options in both Roseville and neighboring Folsom.

amenities.name: Local residents
amenities.description: Local residents have the benefit of easy access to several regional recreational amenities, including local parks, farmer’s markets, a wide range of regional wineries/breweries and water recreation.

amenities.name: Located mile
amenities.description: Located a mile from Bob Mahan Park, one of Roseville’s larger neighborhood parks, features fitness equipment amenities, a school-aged playground, full court basketball court, baseball and soccer fields, tennis courts with lights, and dozens picnic areas.

amenities.name: Less than
amenities.description: Less than 15 miles east is the Folsom Lake State Recreation Area. Which offers visitors scenic opportunities for hiking, biking, running, camping, picnicking, horseback riding, water-skiing and boating at dozens of spots around Folsom Lake’s 75-mile shoreline.
